title: JazzyJester
author: JazzyJester
content: Hello Bitcointalk community!I am thrilled to be joining this forum and engaging with fellow cryptocurrency enthusiasts. My name is I am JazzyJester, and I have been interested in Bitcoin and blockchain technology for some time now. I have followed the growth and evolution of cryptocurrencies closely and am excited to be part of this community.I have been visiting BitcoinTalk for more than a year after a friend recommended it to me, and today I decided to register. Now I am here to learn and share my knowledge and experiences with all of you. I believe that cryptocurrency is more than just a financial investment; it represents a new way of thinking about money, technology, and society. I hope to engage in lively discussions and debates about the future of cryptocurrencies and their impact on our world.I look forward to getting to know you all better and contributing to the Bitcointalk community.Cheers,JazzyJester

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum... I will recommend you read through the rules of the forum in other to make your time here interesting, and avoid making mistakes of breaking any rules. This might be a great start: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Welcome, I hope you enjoy participating in the forum.It will always be good to know new experiences, and discuss other points of view.The forum is a world where you can learn a lot and share knowledge. But if you've been visiting it for some time, you already know this.Once again welcome and have a nice stay.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: You I'm very welcome to the forum. You are going to like it here. Just like you a couple of years ago I registered on this forum and I have never regretted it. I hope your time here would be filled with learning more about bitcoin and cryptocurrency ecosystem and all the things that relate to Bitcoin. While you are here I just want to mention some things that has helped me in this forum- don't plagiarize- be respectful of others- if you are here to make money you will be disappointed. - contribute positively to the growth of the forum and you will be happy you did.

comments.author: JazzyJester
comments.body: Thank you for the warm welcome Davidvictorson! I'm excited to be a part of this forum and to learn more about the world of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency. It's great to hear that you have been a member for a couple of years and have had a positive experience. I'm looking forward to interacting with the community and gaining valuable insights and knowledge. Thanks again for all the others who replied for the encouragement and I hope to contribute to the discussions here as well.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: This community is a lovely place to be part of,learning is a gradual process and you shouldn't be eager to know everything at once. If there is anything that you are confused on about bitcoin investment,feel free to ask.Thee are so many boards of discussion here so feel free to navigate on various board and discuss on boards of your interest. This is not a place to make ¬†money, so if this is what is in your mind,you should take that off your mind and see this forum as a place to acquire knowledge that will help you in your bitcoin journey.Welcome on board

comments.author: MeCsc
comments.created_time: March 28, 2023, 08:24:46 PMLast edit: March 28, 2023, 08:40:49 PM by MeCsc
comments.body: Just discovered that when an account is recently created and the user makes a post it, The user is seen as Brand New and not as a Newbie. Quote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:49:30 PMI'm excited to be a part of this forum and to learn more about the world of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Welcome to this Forum though Am currently learning with this resources 5 Resources to teach Average Joe about Bitcoin

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: MeCsc on March 28, 2023, 08:24:46 PMJust discovered that when an account is recently created and the user makes a post it, The user is seen as Brand New and not as a Newbie. That's because it takes a little while before the activity of the user reflects and once it does the rank change from brand new to newbie. And if you check your image the activity of that user is still zero so that's why nothing has happened to its rank. p.s. please reduce the size of your image to perhaps 200 or 300.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: Quote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:17:13 PMI have been visiting BitcoinTalk for more than a year after a friend recommended it to me.I didn‚Äôt know people still hang around for so long before creating an account. I would like to welcome to the forum as a member. I‚Äôm sure you already read the rules of the forum and how the forum functions. Here are some threads incase you missed them.¬† Forum rulesForum ranks/positions/badges (What do those shiny coins under my name mean?Hidden pages/ features on the forum Do not post off topic replies

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If you've been around for more than a year as a guest, you should be familiar with the forum rules and modus operandi by now. It is an encouraged practice to take some time to read about the forum and acquire knowledge before registering an account when you are ready to contribute.I would be looking forward to your contributions.Quote from: MeCsc on March 28, 2023, 08:24:46 PMJust discovered that when an account is recently created and the user makes a post it, The user is seen as Brand New and not as a Newbie. An account, no matter how old it is, would be 'brand new' rank until it gets at least 1 activity, at which time it would be a newbie ranked account. Majority of users fall in this rank and never make a post.Here's an account registered since 2015, but is still brand new.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Welcome buddy....It's simply all about your determination and good sense of reasoning... These two will ofcourse, pave way for you if you're serious about everything.Welcome once again' into this great forum: for alot have been welcomed Just like you have, and it ends in an awful way. Be guided....Avoid what should be avoided, stay calm and focus and always have a target at hand, ¬†you won't even believe your eyes when you're at the top. See ya out there buddy!!Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:17:13 PMHello Bitcointalk community!I am thrilled to be joining this forum and engaging with fellow cryptocurrency enthusiasts. My name is I am JazzyJester, and I have been interested in Bitcoin and blockchain technology for some time now. I have followed the growth and evolution of cryptocurrencies closely and am excited to be part of this community.I have been visiting BitcoinTalk for more than a year after a friend recommended it to me, and today I decided to register. Now I am here to learn and share my knowledge and experiences with all of you. I believe that cryptocurrency is more than just a financial investment; it represents a new way of thinking about money, technology, and society. I hope to engage in lively discussions and debates about the future of cryptocurrencies and their impact on our world.I look forward to getting to know you all better and contributing to the Bitcointalk community.You are welcome to bitcointalk.org, where you can learn and share your own ideas. Considering that you stated that you have been a member for almost a year, I assume you have picked up some knowledge during that time.All that is required of you is that you adhere to the forum's rules and regulations.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:17:13 PMI am thrilled to be joining this forum and engaging with fellow cryptocurrency enthusiasts.You should be a Bitcoin enthusiast before you turn yourself to cryptocurrency enthusiast.If you start as cryptocurrency enthusiast, after many fails and loses, you will turn yourself to Bitcoin enthusiast.QuoteI have been visiting BitcoinTalk for more than a year after a friend recommended it to me, and today I decided to register. It takes too long time for you to make registration here but welcome. It's never too late to start.Welcome you to Bitcointalk and please read Welcome message for a forum admin.

comments.author: Mr.corol
comments.body: Quote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:17:13 PMSnipWelcome to the bitcoin forum and thanks to your friend who introduced you to bitcoin.You will be regularly active in Bitcoin forums.You will gain more experience from topics discussed about Bitcoin.May your days ahead be better.You get more excited about Bitcoin.Good luck buddy.

My name is I am JazzyJester, and I have been interested in Bitcoin and blockchain technology for some time now. I believe that cryptocurrency is more than just a financial investment; it represents a new way of thinking about money, technology, and society. I hope to engage in lively discussions and debates about the future of cryptocurrencies and their impact on our world.I look forward to getting to know you all better and contributing to the Bitcointalk community.Cheers,JazzyJesterwelcome to this btt forum, friends, don't forget to read the rules that apply in this forum, so that it's better and there are no unnecessary mistakes.you've been monitoring this forum for a year, it means you already know a lot about this forum.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: You are welcome to the forum JazzyJester, I hope you follow the most important advice you get from other members on here, for example reading the rules of the forum before proceeding because as a newbie you won't be able to tell what you could do wrong, I have used other crypto forums online but believe me, bitcointalk forum differs from other crypto forums.Avoid Plagiarism and Spamming at all costs, I believe these two are the most important that could lead to a ban if care is not taken.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Pokapoka124 on March 28, 2023, 08:51:37 PM~snip~I didn‚Äôt know people still hang around for so long before creating an account. It is not strange to me personally, because I also visited the forum as a guest about one year before I decided to register. It may seem unusual to some, but I think that in this way a person can learn some things and not make some initial mistakes when he registers on the forum and starts writing posts. I can't say with certainty, but probably the forum is visited by a fair number of users who are not members and for some reasons of their own they are not interested in the discussion but only in getting information from others.@JazzyJester, welcome to the forum

comments.author: alexkut987
comments.body: Welcome to this amazing, informative, and welcoming forum where you can expand your knowledge on Bitcoin and cryptocurrency-related topics for free, as long as you are willing to dedicate time to learning.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on March 29, 2023, 11:25:55 AMQuote from: Pokapoka124 on March 28, 2023, 08:51:37 PM~snip~I didn‚Äôt know people still hang around for so long before creating an account. It is not strange to me personally, because I also visited the forum as a guest about one year before I decided to register. It may seem unusual to some, but I think that in this way a person can learn some things and not make some initial mistakes when he registers on the forum and starts writing posts. I can't say with certainty, but probably the forum is visited by a fair number of users who are not members and for some reasons of their own they are not interested in the discussion but only in getting information from others.@JazzyJester, welcome to the forum Yes. It's right. But after claiming that the OP has been here for a year, he can be called a power user, since a year of reading the forum should certainly affect his posts and behavior. Any mistake, even an accidental one, will look like a lie told today in the OP's first post.To be honest, I'm also surprised by this long exposure, and one can hope that we have a real beginner who will really care about information about Bitcoin and not merits and fast promotion in rank.Welcome OP.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Quote from: Pokapoka124 on March 28, 2023, 08:51:37 PMQuote from: JazzyJester on March 28, 2023, 07:17:13 PMI have been visiting BitcoinTalk for more than a year after a friend recommended it to me.I didn‚Äôt know people still hang around for so long before creating an account. I would like to welcome to the forum as a member.I believe people who still lurk around bitcointalk without registering doesn't really visit here on almost daily basis as we do. They may visit once, and get as information as they wish to get and that will be all for this month. Next month they may visit once or twice.Then if you are really engaged in the physical world with work and other things, I think you would be carried away and there is also a room for procrastination and more.Jay welcome to the forum and be a good user of the forum. Please all that was given you to read.
